description: Coined to translate the German konstatierend, using cōnstāt-, the perfect passive participial stem of the Latin verb cōnstō (“I agree, correspond, or fit; I am certain, decided, or consistent”), suffixed with the English -ive, suggesting a hypothetical Latin etymon of the form *cōnstātīvus.

entries.meaning: (linguistics) Pertaining to an utterance relaying information and likely to be regarded as true or false.
(linguistics) An utterance relaying information and likely to be regarded as true or false.
examples: The distinction between constatives and performatives is one of the distinctions that he starts questioning.
